gpt-message.content: You are an expert in hardware design with a deep understanding of Verilog RTL codes. Now I want to train a large language model for code comment generation tasks specifically focused on Verilog RTL codes. And I want you to help me process the raw data, transforming it into suitable formats that can serve as inputs and outputs for the model.

Name of the module and its functionality is as follows: 
Module name: mcb_soft_calibration

Explanation: This module performs soft calibration for a Memory Controller Block (MCB). It handles initialization, termination calibration, and dynamic calibration of DQS (Data Strobe) signals. The module goes through various states to configure I/O settings, adjust termination values, and fine-tune DQS delays. It manages the calibration process for both input and output termination, as well as dynamic DQS calibration. The module also handles self-refresh requests and implements a state machine to control the calibration sequence. Overall, it aims to optimize memory interface timing and signal integrity for improved performance and reliability.

Input and output ports and their explanation is as follows: 
Input ports:
UI_CLK, RST, PLL_LOCK, SELFREFRESH_REQ, SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE, RZQ_IN, RZQ_IODRP_SDO, ZIO_IN, ZIO_IODRP_SDO, MCB_UOSDO, MCB_UODONECAL, MCB_UOREFRSHFLAG, MCB_UODATA, MCB_UODATAVALID, MCB_UOCMDREADY, MCB_UO_CAL_START.

Explanation:
UI_CLK: User interface clock input.
RST: Reset signal.
PLL_LOCK: PLL lock signal.
SELFREFRESH_REQ: Self-refresh request signal.
SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE: Self-refresh MCB mode signal.
RZQ_IN, ZIO_IN: Reference impedance inputs.
RZQ_IODRP_SDO, ZIO_IODRP_SDO: IODRP serial data outputs for RZQ and ZIO.
MCB_UOSDO: MCB user output serial data.
MCB_UODONECAL: MCB user output done calibration signal.
MCB_UOREFRSHFLAG: MCB user output refresh flag.
MCB_UODATA: MCB user output data.
MCB_UODATAVALID: MCB user output data valid signal.
MCB_UOCMDREADY: MCB user output command ready signal.
MCB_UO_CAL_START: MCB user output calibration start signal.

Output ports:
DONE_SOFTANDHARD_CAL, SELFREFRESH_MCB_REQ, SELFREFRESH_MODE, IODRP_ADD, IODRP_SDI, RZQ_IODRP_CS, ZIO_IODRP_CS, MCB_UIADD, MCB_UISDI, MCB_UICS, MCB_UIDRPUPDATE, MCB_UIBROADCAST, MCB_UIADDR, MCB_UICMDEN, MCB_UIDONECAL, MCB_UIDQLOWERDEC, MCB_UIDQLOWERINC, MCB_UIDQUPPERDEC, MCB_UIDQUPPERINC, MCB_UILDQSDEC, MCB_UILDQSINC, MCB_UIREAD, MCB_UIUDQSDEC, MCB_UIUDQSINC, MCB_RECAL, MCB_UICMD, MCB_UICMDIN, MCB_UIDQCOUNT, MCB_SYSRST, Max_Value, CKE_Train.

Explanation:
DONE_SOFTANDHARD_CAL: Indicates completion of soft and hard calibration.
SELFREFRESH_MCB_REQ, SELFREFRESH_MODE: Self-refresh related control signals.
IODRP_ADD, IODRP_SDI: IODRP address and serial data input signals.
RZQ_IODRP_CS, ZIO_IODRP_CS: IODRP chip select signals for RZQ and ZIO.
MCB_UIADD, MCB_UISDI, MCB_UICS, MCB_UIDRPUPDATE, MCB_UIBROADCAST, MCB_UIADDR, MCB_UICMDEN, MCB_UIDONECAL: MCB user input control signals.
MCB_UIDQLOWERDEC, MCB_UIDQLOWERINC, MCB_UIDQUPPERDEC, MCB_UIDQUPPERINC: DQ calibration control signals.
MCB_UILDQSDEC, MCB_UILDQSINC, MCB_UIUDQSDEC, MCB_UIUDQSINC: LDQS and UDQS calibration control signals.
MCB_UIREAD, MCB_RECAL, MCB_UICMD, MCB_UICMDIN, MCB_UIDQCOUNT: MCB user input control and status signals.
MCB_SYSRST: MCB system reset signal.
Max_Value: Maximum calibration value output.
CKE_Train: CKE training signal for DDR2 memory.

Internal signals and their explanation is as follows: 
Internal signals:

STATE, P_Term, N_Term, P_Term_s, N_Term_s, P_Term_w, N_Term_w, P_Term_Prev, N_Term_Prev, IODRPCTRLR_MEMCELL_ADDR, IODRPCTRLR_WRITE_DATA, Active_IODRP, IODRPCTRLR_R_WB, IODRPCTRLR_CMD_VALID, IODRPCTRLR_USE_BKST, MCB_CMD_VALID, MCB_USE_BKST, Pre_SYSRST, IODRP_SDO, Max_Value_Previous, count, counter_en, First_Dyn_Cal_Done, DQS_DELAY_INITIAL, DQS_DELAY, TARGET_DQS_DELAY, counter_inc, counter_dec, RST_reg, Block_Reset, MCB_UODATAVALID_U, LastPass_DynCal, First_In_Term_Done.

Explanation:

STATE: Current state of the calibration state machine.
P_Term, N_Term: P-term and N-term values for termination calibration.
P_Term_s, N_Term_s, P_Term_w, N_Term_w: Skewed P-term and N-term values for different calibration stages.
P_Term_Prev, N_Term_Prev: Previous P-term and N-term values for comparison.
IODRPCTRLR_MEMCELL_ADDR: Memory cell address for IODRP controller.
IODRPCTRLR_WRITE_DATA: Write data for IODRP controller.
Active_IODRP: Currently active IODRP (RZQ, ZIO, or MCB_PORT).
IODRPCTRLR_R_WB: Read/Write control for IODRP controller.
IODRPCTRLR_CMD_VALID, MCB_CMD_VALID: Command valid signals for IODRP and MCB controllers.
IODRPCTRLR_USE_BKST, MCB_USE_BKST: Broadcast control signals for IODRP and MCB controllers.
Pre_SYSRST: Internal system reset signal.
IODRP_SDO: IODRP serial data output.
Max_Value_Previous: Previous maximum calibration value.
count, counter_en: Counter and enable signal for timing purposes.
First_Dyn_Cal_Done: Flag indicating completion of first dynamic calibration.
DQS_DELAY_INITIAL, DQS_DELAY, TARGET_DQS_DELAY: DQS delay values for calibration.
counter_inc, counter_dec: Counters for increment and decrement operations.
RST_reg: Registered reset signal.
Block_Reset: Signal to block reset during certain operations.
MCB_UODATAVALID_U: Registered MCB user output data valid signal.
LastPass_DynCal: Flag indicating the last pass of dynamic calibration.
First_In_Term_Done: Flag indicating completion of first input termination calibration.

These internal signals are used to control the calibration process, store intermediate values, and manage the state machine's operation throughout the soft calibration procedure.
